messages.author: awong
messages.text:
Can we fix this combine the all the Stop/DoStop, SetMaxRate/DoSetMaxRate functions?

Can be a separate CL, but we should fix the convention.

messages.author: awong
messages.text:
Is this a normal condition?

If so, should we warn?

messages.author: awong
messages.text: This class's comment needs a description of the various states that it can be in, and what that logically means.  We don't need to list out exactly which functions are allowed, but having the states listed out would help

messages.author: Alpha
messages.text:
On 2011/01/20 20:14:00, awong wrote:
> Can we fix this combine the all the Stop/DoStop, SetMaxRate/DoSetMaxRate
> functions?
> 
> Can be a separate CL, but we should fix the convention.

will do separately.

messages.author: Alpha
messages.text:
On 2011/01/20 20:14:00, awong wrote:
> Is this a normal condition?
> 
> If so, should we warn?

You're right, this should be a DCHECK. The check in the next method is valid though.

messages.author: Alpha

> in, and what that logically means.  We don't need to list out exactly which
> functions are allowed, but having the states listed out would help

Done.

messages.author: awong
messages.text: What's the invariant that this is testing?  Can you add a 1-line comment above the TEST_F?

messages.author: Alpha
messages.text:
On 2011/01/20 20:14:00, awong wrote:
> What's the invariant that this is testing?  Can you add a 1-line comment above

Done.

messages.author: Sergey Ulanov
messages.text: After looking at this again: This is supposed to be set in Init(). It's better to fix Init() so that it sets this callback instead of removing it completely.

messages.author: Alpha
messages.text:
On 2011/01/20 20:56:26, sergeyu wrote:
> After looking at this again: This is supposed to be set in Init(). It's better
> to fix Init() so that it sets this callback instead of removing it completely.

Removed from this patch.
